fields.name: Kilogram
fields.description: Kilogram (kg): Used for heavy or bulk items like fruits, vegetables, grains, etc.

fields.name: Gram
fields.description: Gram (g): Typically used for smaller quantities like spices, nuts, or packaged goods.

fields.name: Milligram
fields.description: Milligram (mg): For extremely small quantities, commonly seen in vitamins or supplements.

fields.name: Pound
fields.description: Pound (lb): Used in some countries, often for meat or produce.

fields.name: Ounce
fields.description: Ounce (oz): Commonly used for smaller weights, especially in prepackaged goods.

fields.name: Liter
fields.description: Liter (L): Common for beverages, milk, and other liquids.

fields.name: Milliliter
fields.description: Milliliter (mL): Used for small quantities of liquids, like sauces or beverages.

fields.name: Cubic Meter
fields.description: Cubic Meter (m³): Typically used for very large volumes of liquid or bulk materials, rare in retail.

fields.name: Gallon
fields.description: Gallon (gal): Common in some countries, especially for milk, fuel, or large beverage containers.

fields.name: Quart
fields.description: Quart (qt): Used in some countries, mainly for liquids.

fields.name: Pint
fields.description: Pint (pt): Common for beverages, ice cream, or sauces.

fields.name: Fluid Ounce
fields.description: Fluid Ounce (fl oz): Used for smaller liquid quantities.

fields.name: Cubic Centimeter
fields.description: Cubic Centimeter (cc): Used for very small quantities, often in the medical or scientific fields.

fields.name: Teaspoon
fields.description: Teaspoon (tsp): Often used for baking ingredients or spices.

fields.name: Tablespoon
fields.description: Tablespoon (tbsp): Slightly larger, used for dry ingredients in baking or cooking.

fields.name: Cup
fields.description: Cup: Often used for both liquid and dry ingredients in baking.

fields.name: Peck
fields.description: Peck (pk): Rare, but used for larger quantities of dry goods like apples.

fields.name: Bushel
fields.description: Bushel (bu): Also rare, used for large volumes of dry goods, e.g., grains, fruits.

fields.name: Meter
fields.description: Meter (m): Rare but sometimes used for items like fabric or certain packaging.

fields.name: Centimeter
fields.description: Centimeter (cm): Can be used for small, measurable items like rope or ribbon.

fields.name: Inch
fields.description: Inch (in): Also used for small items or packaging materials.

fields.name: Piece
fields.description: Piece (pc): Often used for items sold individually like fruits (e.g., 1 apple) or prepackaged goods.

fields.name: Pack
fields.description: Pack (pk): Used for bundled items like a pack of water bottles, eggs, or candy.

fields.name: Dozen
fields.description: Dozen (dz): For items like eggs, often sold in multiples of twelve.

fields.name: Pair
fields.description: Pair (pr): Used when two items come together, like gloves or shoes.

fields.name: Tray
fields.description: Tray: For items sold in a tray, like a tray of fruit or baked goods.

fields.name: Case
fields.description: Case (case): Bulk packaging, commonly for drinks or canned goods.

fields.name: Box
fields.description: Box (box): For pre-packaged goods like cereal or snacks.

fields.name: Bottle
fields.description: Bottle (bottle): For liquids like wine, sauces, or soft drinks.

fields.name: Can
fields.description: Can (can): For items sold in cans, like soda, beans, or soup.

fields.name: Bag
fields.description: Bag (bag): For products sold in bags, like rice, chips, or snacks.

fields.name: Jar
fields.description: Jar (jar): For goods like jam, honey, or pickles.

fields.name: Carton
fields.description: Carton (carton): For products like eggs or juice.

fields.name: Slice
fields.description: Slice (slice): For items like sliced bread or cheese.
